refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a reboot intervention resource onto a host or cluster.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The aq add_reboot_intervention command adds a reboot intervention resource onto a host or a cluster. This is a temporary modification of host configuration to prevent scheduled reboots.
The intervention will apply after host compilation and NCM update and so should be done in plenty of time before the scheduled reboot is to take place.
Only a single reboot intervention can be in place at once.

refsect1.title: Templates
refsect1.para: This command will modify the templates for the host or cluster (depending on which option was given) and the resource template for the intervention itself.

listitem.para: Specify the target host for the intervention.
The name of the target cluster for the intervention.

A date when the intervention should expire. The date format is anything that the python library dateutil.parser can understand. This treats treats the date as the whole day inclusive to expiry. Time of the expiry is ignored.
Extra authorization tokens (e.g. change management reference ID) to with which the system can validate or correlate the request.
A date when the intervention should start. The date format is anything that the python library dateutil.parser can understand.
Any additional notes for the intervention.

example.title: Suspending reboot
example.programlisting: aq add reboot intervention --hostname foo.example.com \ --justification tcm=6001234 --expiry 1/1/2012
example.para: Which results in no scheduled reboots for the host until January 1, 2012.
